news_header: The UK government plans to spend over £2.6bn in the next two years to protect homes and businesses from flooding, increasing funding for flood defenses amid rising climate risks.
news_original_title: Spending on flood defences set to rise to record levels
news_text: The UK government has announced it will invest over £2.6 billion over the next two years to enhance flood protection for homes and businesses in England, which is £250 million more than previously disclosed. This funding will support various projects, including tidal barriers and nature-based solutions. Currently, 6.3 million homes are at risk of flooding, a figure that could rise to eight million by 2050 due to climate change. The Environment Secretary criticized the previous government's handling of flood defenses, while a shadow minister defended past investments. Nearly 1,000 projects will benefit from this funding, improving protection for over 66,000 vulnerable properties.
